verse.roman:
yato yad anuśikṣāmi
yathā vā nāhuṣātmaja
tat tathā puruṣa-vyāghra
nibodha kathayāmi te

synonyms: yataḥ—from whom; yat—what; anuśikṣāmi—I have learned; yathā—how; vā—and; nāhuṣa-ātma-ja—O son of King Nāhuṣa (Yayāti); tat—that; tathā—thus; puruṣa-vyāghra—O tiger among men; nibodha—listen; kathayāmi—I will recount; te—to you.
translation: Please listen, O son of Mahārāja Yayāti, O tiger among men, as I explain to you what I have learned from each of these gurus.
